ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Best songs
ygData.msgSnippet: I want to know how the druid got starfire at L38. :) ... -- Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity. GAT d- -p+(--) c++++ l++ u++ t-
ygData.messageBody:
I want to know how the druid got starfire at L38. :)

On Tue, Mar 14/00, "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...> wrote:
> From: "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...>
>
> LOL, that was my answer :) Actually the full answer was:
> Hmmmmm
> Afk singing Clarity. Why? If a full group at 38th can't take a one white
> mob then something is seriously wrong.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Eric Boller [mailto:eboller@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, March 14, 2000 6:19 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Best songs
>
>
> From: Eric Boller <eboller@...>
>
> Shut up and just play manasong!
>
> Thex Luteslinger (Tunare)
> 37th level bard
>
> > What is are the best three songs for a bard to play
> > given an
> > all level-38 group with a warrior (1500 hp, avg
> > damage 20
> > pts/rnd), ranger (1300 hp, avg damage 18 pts/rnd),
> > paladin
> > (1400 hp, avg damage 15 pts/rnd), cleric (1800 mana,
> > only
> > healing), druid (1500 mana, only nuking with
> > starfire),
> > fighting a level-38 melee mob (3500 hp, avg damage
> > 40 pts/hit
> > with an average of 2 attacks per round at a 70% hit
> > rate)?
> >
> > --
> > John H. Kim
> > kim@...
>
